title: Ekko Homeguard Bug

replies.body:
why can't you post this on every bug report? just for the players to know if you have it logged in or not. Afaik rioters read every post, right? (it's fine if you only answer to this part)

I mean, i would really love this feature on the bug boards in which, if a rioter looked into it and logged in, the post will show green, or the title, or a sign or something (a thumbs up). If it's not a bug, it will be red (or thumbs down). If it's nothing, grey or something. 

This would really decrease the amount of same requests being added to the bug reports. It would be nice to also have a better search in the forum. I almost never use it, cause it's dull.

How about letting us search in your logged bug files to know which ones are logged in? If they're you've got 1 less report per player

**why can't you post this on every bug report? just for the players to know if you have it logged in or not. Afaik rioters read every post, right? (it's fine if you only answer to this part)**

Rioters from various teams do read the boards, yes. I personally try to reply to as many skins-related issues as possible. To play devil's advocate, it can become difficult to reply to each thread, as well as tackling our daily in-house work, especially with the release of larger patches; Star Guardian or Elementalist Lux. I know I've had issues keeping up with replying in the past, which is why I've started tracking all skins-related bug fixes in the patch notes. It's a central location for any/all fixes we've done. It isn't perfect, but it's a start for better visibility. 

**I mean, i would really love this feature on the bug boards in which, if a rioter looked into it and logged in, the post will show green, or the title, or a sign or something (a thumbs up). If it's not a bug, it will be red (or thumbs down). If it's nothing, grey or something.**

I agree that it'd be a nice feature to have. I don't manage the structure of the boards, so I can't speak to what kind of work that'd take. Happy to suggest it, though! 

**How about letting us search in your logged bug files to know which ones are logged in? If they're you've got 1 less report per player**

That's a hard no, only because we also have bugs logged for upcoming unreleased content that's in testing - it's a huge security risk.

> To play devil's advocate, it can become difficult to reply to each thread, as well as tackling our daily in-house work, especially with the release of larger patches

Honestly, I'd appreciate even a copy/pasta message just to acknowledge the Bug is known and logged. I made 3 detailed Bug reports with repro steps and video clips and everything, and I still don't know if a Rioter has even seen them. I guess so, I know you guys read a lot of stuff on the boards even when you don't reply, but I don't **know** and that's a bit disheartening... (For the records, it wasn't on Skins.)

Of course, the "green posts" suggested by AnataBakka would be perfect, but even a simple copy/pasta would be great.

exactly, it's got more value on the bug reports since players may report the same bugs if they happens constantly and annoy them. 

There's something that gets on my mind tho. I would be ok with that, but others may not, right? Some people may then post threads like "Why did you think my bug is not a bug", and this may annoy rioters. 
Stiil, making a big thread saying "We won't comment to every post and posts asking why we didn't consider it a bug won't be looked on" may keep those posts away.

I think having a bot automatically reply when a rioter tells it too is the best choice.
